alert.note: Alert for Wind River Mountains West (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 04 at 4:10AM MST until January 06 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHERE...Western slopes of the Wind River Mountains. * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, moderate snow at times. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow and significant blowing snow are possible. Total snow accumulations between 12 and 18 inches possible over the north, which includes Union Pass. South Pass looks to receive 5 to 10 inches. * WHEN...The Winter Weather Advisory is through 11 AM this morning. The Winter Storm Watch is in effect from 11 PM tonight to 5 PM Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Visibility could be down to a tenth of a mile at times. People recreating in the backcountry could become disoriented. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Please monitor JHAVALANCHE.ORG for the avalanche risk across western Wyoming.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, water, and a charger for your cell phone in case of an emergency. Call 5 1 1, to get the latest road conditions.
